result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Derrell Grayson Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesse Derrell Grayson Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jesse Derrell Grayson Jr. was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Jesse Derrell Grayson Jr. was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesse Derrell Grayson in court with attorney Megan Barbara.  Defendant Jesse Derrell Grayson in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
COURT ORDERED THE DOMESTIC ABUSE ENHANCER STRUCK AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 4.
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 193 days time served. 
.
AS TO COUNT 4:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 3 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served. 

 Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by the end of extended supervision in 14CF1838.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Jesse Derrell Grayson in court with attorney Megan Barbara.  Defendant Jesse Derrell Grayson in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered charges dismissed.
*
AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 4:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect. On motion of the defense, Court reinstated defendant's privileges.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Reinstating Defendant's Telephone/Mail/Visitation Privileges signed and filed.  rmm
from the defense received and filed.  rmm
from the defense received and filed.  rmm

Attorney Megan Barbara in court, defendant Jesse Derrell Grayson not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held off the record.  Case remains set for jury trial on 8/04/14 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.

Defendant Jesse Derrell Grayson in court with attorney Megan Barbara.  Defendant Jesse Derrell Grayson in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial.  Parties are still in negotiations and would like an adjournment.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.
On motion of the state, Court ordered defendant's Telephone, Visitation and US Mail privileges revoked. State to submit proposed order.

Defendant Jesse Derrell Grayson in court with attorney Megan Barbara.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held.  On motion of the state, Court ordered 14CF1838 and 14CF452 joined for the purpose of trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jesse Derrell Grayson in court with attorney Megan Barbara.  Defendant Jesse Derrell Grayson in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Defendant has picked up a new case which is coming to this court for preliminary hearing.  On motion of the state, Court found cause to waive the speedy trial time limits and ordered this matter adjourned.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jesse Derrell Grayson in court with attorney Megan Barbara.  Defendant Jesse Derrell Grayson in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final pre-trial held with the parties.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial in Branch 40.
Court advises defendant that the No Contact Order remains in effect.

  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Case remains set for final pretrial conference on 4/21/14 at 8:30 am.
for Bail Reduction or Modification received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

Defendant Jesse Derrell Grayson in court with attorney Megan Barbara.  Defendant Jesse Derrell Grayson in custody.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Br. 4 for Br. 40.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Dorian Andress.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss without argument heard and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Discovery was turned over to defense counsel from the State.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 40 on 4-21-2014 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial 5-5-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Eileen J. or Khelan L.

Defendant Jesse Derrell Grayson in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Jesse Derrell Grayson in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor counts 2, 3 and 4.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
